alert.note: Alert for Absaroka Mountains; Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Yellowstone National Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 7:04PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Hot Springs, northwestern Fremont, southeastern Park and northeastern Teton Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 703 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles northeast of Pinnacle Buttes, which is also 23 miles north of Dubois, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Yellowstone National Park
